author: Thomas M. Burton
title: House Introduces ‘Right to Try’ Legislation to Permit Use of Unproven Drugs for Dying Patients
text:
WASHINGTON—A House of Representatives committee early Saturday issued its version of “Right to Try” legislation that would enable a terminally ill patient to use an unproven, investigational drug in an effort to save that person’s life.
Such legislation was passed in August by the Senate and supported by President Donald Trump in his State of the Union address. The conservative Goldwater Institute, which has helped such bills become law in 38 states, has been a prime driver of the idea.
